player: DeAndre Bembry (personal) will not suit up for Tuesday's game against the Nets.
After having a discussion with head coach Mike Budenholzer about the role he'll have in Atlanta, Mike Dunleavy has agreed to join the Hawks and he'll report for his physical on Tuesday.
Mike Scott did not play in the D-League on Wednesday due to lower left leg muscle soreness.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nets.
Trevor Booker (hip) is being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Hawks.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) has been ruled out for Tuesday's game against the Hawks.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Raptors.
James Young (ankle) will not play for at least one more week.
Tyler Zeller (illness) is listed as out for Tuesday's game vs. the Raptors.
Cody Zeller (illness) is being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Rockets.
Nicolas Batum (knee) is doubtful to play Tuesday vs. the Rockets.
Jimmy Butler (illness) is a game-time call on Monday vs. the Thunder.
Denzel Valentine (ankle) said he's optimistic that he will play on Monday vs. the Thunder.
Kyle Korver is hopeful that he'll be able to make his Cavs' debut on Tuesday vs. the Jazz.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Gary Harris (groin) is a late scratch against the Thunder on Saturday.
Nikola Jokic (illness) will not play against the Thunder on Saturday.
Jon Leuer has no ligament or cartilage damage to his right knee according to coach Stan Van Gundy.
Eric Gordon (sprained big left toe) is being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Hornets.
Clint Capela (knee) is on track to return to the court by mid-to-late January.
As expected, Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) has been ruled out of Saturday's game vs. the Knicks.
Austin Rivers (illness) will not play on Sunday vs. the Heat.
Blake Griffin (knee) had a routine follow-up examination on Thursday and coach Doc Rivers said Griffin "looked great" and is making progress.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
The Lakers expect Larry Nance (knee) to return in about two weeks.
Deyonta Davis suffered a torn plantar fascia and will miss 6-8 weeks.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.
Luke Babbitt (illness) has been ruled out for Sunday's game against the Clippers.
Josh Richardson (foot) said he's unsure of when he will be able to return.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Michael Beasley (shin) is probable to play Tuesday vs. the Spurs.
Giannis Antetokounmpo (illness), Michael Beasley (shin) and Rashad Vaughn (ankle) are all being listed as probable for Tuesday's game against the Spurs.
Rashad Vaughn (left ankle) is being listed as probable for Tuesday's game in San Antonio.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
The 76ers have recalled Richaun Holmes (concussion) from the D-League.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) did some on-court work at T.D. Garden before Friday's game against the Celtics.
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.
David Lee (left knee contusion) returned to practice on Monday.
Jared Sullinger (foot) was getting shots up before Thursday's game against the Jazz.
Scott Brooks said that Bradley Beal (ankle) is "fine."
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
